site.name: Ace Data Cloud
site.description: Ace Data Cloud is being built as an AI infrastructure platform for builders and teams who need reliable access, workflows, and monetization across modern AI systems.

overview.title: Ace Data Cloud 2026 Roadmap
paragraphs: Ace Data Cloud is being built as an AI infrastructure platform for builders and teams who need reliable access, workflows, and monetization across modern AI systems.

intro.title: Platform Overview
intro.subtitle: The Ace Data Cloud platform is a global SaaS service provider that offers stable and comprehensive digital services for both enterprises and individuals.

cards.title: For enterprises and developers
paragraphs: Ace Data Cloud provides a range of production-grade API services and infrastructure capabilities for modern AI systems.
bullets: AI Q&A APIs (OpenAI, DeepSeek, etc.)
AI images (Midjourney, Flux)
AI music (Suno)
AI videos (Luma, Pika)
HTTP proxies (mobile cellular, residential, global)
Datasets and data pipelines

cards.title: For individuals
paragraphs: A one-stop, user-friendly interface for AI Q&A, images, music, videos, proxies, datasets and more — compatible with desktop and mobile.
Includes out-of-the-box login authorization (WeChat, Google, GitHub) and payments.

cards.title: Open-source distribution (Nexior)
paragraphs: We have open-sourced the UI and distribution layer — Nexior. Build your own one-stop AI platform in minutes and sell it for profit.

items.title: Product and usage come first
items.description: Token mechanisms follow real adoption, not the other way around.

items.title: Capital decisions reduce risk
items.description: Liquidity, runway, and operational stability matter more than short-term signals.

items.title: Clarity over activity
items.description: Shipping clearly is better than doing more.

items.title: Long-term credibility beats short-term attention
items.description: We optimize for trust with builders, partners, and serious stakeholders.

what_building.title: What Ace Is Building
intro_paragraphs: Ace Data Cloud is the infrastructure layer that powers multiple products through shared accounts, APIs, and billing.

sections.title: Core Products (Separate, API-Bound)
paragraphs: Nexior is a core application and distribution product of Ace Data Cloud. It is a UI-driven product that directly consumes Ace APIs to deploy, distribute, and monetize AI applications, templates, and assets.
Dify is a standalone workflow product that runs independently as a separate website. It is an open-source, well-known project focused on advanced workflow orchestration and logic.
bullets: Both are auto-bound to Ace Data Cloud accounts
Both automatically bind Ace API keys
Both consume the same underlying Ace infrastructure
Both are available to all Ace Data Cloud customers

sections.title: Infrastructure Layers
bullets: Unified AI Gateway provides execution reliability and multi-model access
Workflows (via Dify) provide powerful composition, orchestration, and reuse
x402 provides settlement and monetization
Apps and templates provide distribution and discovery

sections.title: Ace focuses on four core layers
bullets: Unified AI Gateway for multi-model access
Workflow orchestration via Dify
Distribution through Nexior templates, skills, and apps
Settlement via native payment and billing infrastructure

phases.label: Q1 2026
phases.title: Foundation and Clarity
phases.focus: Reliable delivery, workflow backbone, and disciplined structure

items.title: Continue strengthening the unified AI gateway with improved reliability, routing control, and cost visibility
Finalize and ship Dify as a standalone workflow product with tighter Ace account and API binding
Strengthen core platform flows including onboarding, usage tracking, billing, and value delivery
Improve visibility across the platform so users can clearly see what is live, in progress, or planned
Launch the Ace mobile app on Android and iOS
Focus the app on high-frequency, template-first use cases rather than experimentation
Route app usage directly into workflows and Nexior distribution
Establish workflows as a core orchestration layer through Dify
Enable composable pipelines across model calls, data handling, distribution actions, and billing
Prepare workflow structures for broader standards alignment later in the year
Base x402 payment integration is live
Finalize Solana x402 payment integration within Q1, enabling call-to-pay settlement for additional live use cases
Continue expanding Nexior templates and publishing flows
Prioritize reproducibility and quality over volume
Begin early contributor feedback loops without aggressive incentives
Deprioritize discretionary buybacks at this stage
Focus on liquidity depth, stability, and conservative capital use
Maintain clear separation between platform operations and market-facing mechanisms

phases.label: Q2 2026
phases.title: Adoption and Usage Signals
phases.focus: Lower friction, broader entry points, and visible real usage

items.title: Expand adoption of the mobile app through improved UX, stability, and workflow depth
Increase template-driven usage and real production activity
Strengthen the feedback loop between app usage, workflows, and Nexior distribution
Expand x402-based settlement into more production workflows
Improve receipts, billing transparency, and automated settlement for developers and agents
Roll out structured data services as a real product line
Establish clear standards for ingestion, processing, and delivery
Bind data more tightly into workflows so it becomes part of production pipelines
Land the first wave of practical partnerships
Focus on co-built templates, integrations, and real delivery rather than announcements
Scale routing, fallback strategies, and concurrency support
Improve stability under higher and more complex workloads
Expand workflow modules into more standardized, reusable components
Strengthen Nexior discovery and recommendation so high-quality contributions are easier to find and adopt
Improve contributor earning clarity tied to real usage
Continue careful research into staking and long-term participation models
No rushed deployments
Any pilot remains limited in scope and focused on contribution, not yield
Deliver predictable release cadence
Reduce operational surprises
Position Ace as a dependable platform rather than a toolbox
Push toward a more self-sustaining loop of contributors, distribution, and usage
Reduce reliance on manual curation or intervention
Re-evaluate buybacks only if: platform revenue is meaningfully larger, liquidity depth is already strong, and any buyback activity remains small, non-disruptive, and transparently disclosed
Staking, if expanded, follows data from pilots and prioritizes stability

token_fit.title: How $ACE Fits Into the System
paragraphs: $ACE is designed to strengthen alongside real usage.
bullets: Holding $ACE provides usage-based benefits such as platform fee discounts
Platform usage generates revenue, reinvested into product, hiring, and growth
Trading activity generates creator fees that support liquidity, ecosystem incentives, and reserves
Token mechanisms follow adoption rather than attempting to lead it
The token is not a substitute for product execution

closing.title: Closing
paragraphs: Ace Data Cloud is not optimizing for short-term attention.
bullets: Clear delivery
Real usage
Disciplined capital management
Long-term credibility with builders, partners, and serious stakeholders
closing.final_line: Roadmaps do not create trust. Execution does.
